metadata.title: CVE-2013-4319 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
pbs_mom in Terascale Open-Source Resource and Queue Manager (aka TORQUEResource Manager) 2.5.x, 4.x, and earlier does not properly restrict accessby unprivileged ports, which allows remote authenticated users to executearbitrary jobs by submitting a command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4319` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtorque2 - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1
torque-client - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1
torque-client-x11 - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1
torque-common - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1
torque-mom - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1
torque-pam - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1
torque-scheduler - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1
torque-server - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: torque package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1').
